newsitem.title: USA: FTP Software Q2 to be below its estimates.
newsitem.headline: FTP Software Q2 to be below its estimates.

text.p: FTP Software Inc said on Monday that its second quarter results will fall "substantially below the company's internal goals for the quarter ending June 30, 1997."
In last year's second quarter, the company reported sales of $28.1 million and a loss of $13.1 million, or $0.49 a share.
First Call's survey of two analysts that follow the company listed their consensus earnings estimate at a loss of $0.25 a share.
FTP said its continued weakness in revenue led to the company not meting its previously announced internal goal for revenue growth for 1997.
FTP was not immediately available to comment further about the expected results.

Also, the company said in the same statement as the forecast that it is reorganizing its business into three unites. The company formed the Agent/Directory Management Business Unit, VIP Network Applications, and client server gateway technologys through its IP Technology Business Unit.
